intro: Hymenasplenium hastifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water starwort, is a aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and streams. The plant has slender, branching stems with small, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged. Its flowers are tiny and clustered in dense inflorescences, usually appearing in late spring to early summer. Hymenasplenium hastifolium plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
